register.title: Profile
register.description: This register defines how the product is seen by the hosts: USB or BLE profile, primary interface, primary communication protocol. It implicitly activates either [Operating mode](../../../Introduction/Operating_Modes).

option.title: SpringProx Legacy mode, Serial or CDC
Smart Reader mode, Serial or CDC
ST UHF reader host protocol, Serial or CDC
NXP NFC Cockpit host protocol, Serial or CDC

register.title: USB options
register.description: Control various options related to the USB interface.
register.remark: If the product has no USB interface, this register is ignored.

option.title: USB is disabled, all the other settings are ignored
The actual serial number of the product is provided in the USB descriptor
A constant serial number is provided in the USB descriptor

field.title: On USB bus reset event, does the product fully reset?
field.name: Reset on bus reset
field.remark: Standard behaviour is no, but this does help putting back a battery-powered or externaly-powered product that was connected through Bluetooth or Network to the 'ready for USB operation' state

field.title: On USB bus resume event, does the product fully reset?
field.name: Reset on bus resume
field.remark: Standard behaviour is no, but this does help putting back a battery-powered or externaly-powered product that was connected through Bluetooth or Network to the 'ready for USB operation' state

field.title: Disable SpringCore direct as secondary USB interface.
field.name: No Direct
field.remark: If [Primary profile](Profile) is set to `0` (SpringCore Direct only), this setting is ignored.

option.title: SpringCore Direct is announced in the USB profile
SpringCore Direct is not announced in the USB profile

field.title: Behaviour of the product when USB VBUS is lost and the product is not allowed to keep running
field.name: VBUS down stop action

field.title: Behaviour of the product when USB VBUS is lost
field.name: VBUS down behaviour

option.title: Keep running (either on external power or battery)

register.title: BLE options
register.description: Control various options related to the BLE interface.
register.remark: If the product has no BLE interface, this register is ignored.

option.title: BLE is disabled, all the other settings are ignored

field.title: Disable BLE negociation (use default settings and avoid renegociation).
field.name: Disable negociation

field.title: Use a different address (BT_ADDR) per profile
field.name: Addr per profile

option.title: Une the same BT_ADDR whatever the profile
The first bits of the BT_ADDR change with the profile

field.title: Defines whether the BLE interface requires paired (bonded) connections, or not.
field.name: Force pairing
field.remark: If [Primary profile](Profile) is set to `3` (HID only), this entry MUST be set to 1 for correct operation with the iOS and Android operating systems.

option.title: No pairing required - The BLE profile exposes only unbonded services
Force pairing - The BLE profile exposes only bonded services

field.title: Disable SpringCore direct as secondary BLE interface.
field.name: No Direct
field.remark: If [Primary profile](Profile) is set to `0` (SpringCore Direct only), this setting is ignored.

option.title: SpringCore Direct is announced in the BLE profile
SpringCore Direct is not announced in the BLE profile

field.title: Defines how the BLE interface is used.
field.name: Role

option.title: Device; use the BLE interface to communicate with the host.
Reader; use the BLE interface to read BLE tokens. Use [BLE template](../../Templates/BLE_template) to configure Smart Reader operation with BLE tokens.
Beacon; use the BLE interface for iBeacon brodcasting.

register.title: Profile addons
register.description: Control various options related to the current profile.

field.title: Enable HID Ringer addon used by Telephony services (experimental).
field.name: Enable Ringer

register.title: Battery configuration
register.description: When the product has a battery, this register controls the behaviour of the power button and the power-saving policy.
register.remark: This register is ignored if the product does not have a battery.

option.title: The power button is free to use.
The power button is disabled if host connected.
The product can not use 1A mode.
The product detects and selects LOW or HIGH charge mode.
The product forces HIGH charge mode.
The product can't sleep when connected to a charger.
The product can sleep when connected to a charger.

field.title: Wake up provided by the BLE chip
field.name: Wake up from BGM

option.title: The product can't be wake up by the BLE chip.
The product can be wake up by the BLE chip.
The product stops immediately when the external power supply is unplugged
The power button must be pressed to stop the product
The product starts immediately when an external power supply is plugged
The power button must be pressed to start the product

field.title: Power saving delay, unconnected
field.name: Power saving unconnected
field.description: Number of minutes before shutting down, when the product is running on battery and is not connected to a remote host.

field.title: Power saving delay, connected but idle
field.name: Power saving connected
field.description: Number of minutes before shutting down, when the product is running on battery and is connected to a remote host, but the remote host does not send any command to the product.
field.remark: Disabled by default (the product remains powered as long as the remote host is connected).

register.title: Trace level
register.remark: This register is available only in debug builds of the firmware.

register.title: Trace options
register.remark: This register is available only in debug builds of the firmware.

register.title: Application name
register.description: This register is available to store the name of application or to identify the integrator who has loaded its license in the product. See the [license cryptogram](License_cryptogram) paragraph for details.

register.title: Global UI options
register.description: This register control global UI behaviour.

register.title: Options for the main 4-LED ramp
register.description: For products that have a set of 4 LEDs as primary user interface, this register control their behaviour.
register.remark: This register is ignored if the product's primary UI is an [RGB LED](RGB_LED).

register.title: Settings for the main RGB LED(s)
register.description: For products that have a RGB LED (or a set of RGB LEDs) as primary user interface, this register defines its color and behaviour.

field.title: Color of the RGB LED(s) when the product is active, waiting for a card
field.name: Color

field.title: State of the RGB LED(s) when the product is active, waiting for a card
field.name: State

field.title: Color of the RGB LED(s) when the product is inactive
field.name: Color

field.title: State of the RGB LED(s) when the product is inactive
field.name: State

register.title: Light level for the main RGB LED(s)
register.description: For products that have a RGB LED (or a set of RGB LEDs) as primary user interface, this register control the light level.

field.title: Light level when active
field.name: Full-level luminosity
field.remark: Value is in percent (0-100%). Default is 100%.

field.title: Light level when idle
field.name: Dimmed-level luminosity
field.remark: Value is in percent (0-100%). Default is 75%.

field.title: Delay before switching to dimmed-level luminosity.
field.name: Dimm after
field.remark: Value is in seconds. Default is 10s. Set to 0 to prevent dimming the light.

register.title: Options for the auxiliary LEDs
register.description: For products that have auxiliary LEDs (for instance to show the state of the Bluetooth connection or the battery level), this register control their behaviour.
register.remark: This register is ignored if the product does not have any auxiliary LED.

register.title: Sound options
register.description: Options for the single-tone beeper (aka buzzer) or volume for the enhanced sound driver.
register.remark: This register is ignored if the product does not have a buzzer nor an enhanced sound driver.

field.title: Control whether the product is allowed to beep or define the Volume level. Set to 0 to disable sound. The maximum volume level depends on the product type.
field.name: Volume

register.title: Product Specific
register.description: Custom UI options for specific products.

register.title: Theme selection
register.description: Select which them to use for the UI .

register.title: Access Conditions to configuration & firmware update

option.title: The firmware can be upgraded with no restriction through the Local host interface
Authentication using *HostCommAdminKey* is required to upgrade the firmware
Authentication using *HostCommAdminKey* is required to run sensitive instructions
The firmware can be upgraded with no restriction through the Remote host interface
Authentication using *HostCommAdminKey* is required to upgrade the firmware
Authentication using *HostCommAdminKey* is required to run sensitive instructions

register.note: Whatever the settings in bits 5-4 of bytes 1 and 2, the registers holding the two passwords (`02FE` and `02FF`) can never be read back, and the [Inventory](../Inventory) and [License](../License) registers (`0200` to `020F`) are always readable. When the "Protect admin key and sensitive registers" bit in bytes 1 (Local) and 2 (Remote) is set, the *HostCommAdminKey* and the registers 02F0 to 02FF (including this Access Conditions register itself) can be changed only after an authentication using *HostCommAdminKey*. If this bit is not set, they are treated as all other configuration entries.

register.title: Failed authentication counters
register.description: Protect the product against brute-force attacks

field.title: Counter to lock the Admin password in case of repeated authentication failures
field.name: Admin
field.remark: Set to 0 to disable password locking

field.title: Counter to lock the User password in case of repeated authentication failures
field.name: User
field.remark: Set to 0 to disable password locking

field.title: Counter to lock the Admin authentication key in case of repeated authentication failures
field.name: Admin
field.remark: Set to 0 to disable password locking

field.title: Counter to lock the User authentication key in case of repeated authentication failures
field.name: User
field.remark: Set to 0 to disable password locking

register.title: BLE Tx power
register.description: TX power in 0.1dBm steps

field.title: BLE minimal interval
field.name: MinInterval
field.description: Minimum value for the connection event interval. This must be set be less than or equal to max_interval.

field.title: BLE minimal interval
field.name: MaxInterval
field.description: Maximum value for the connection event interval. This must be set greater than or equal to min_interval.

field.title: BLE slave latency
field.name: SlaveLatency
field.description: This parameter defines how many connection intervals the slave can skip if it has no data to send.

field.title: BLE supervision timeout
field.name: SupervisionTimeout
field.description: The supervision timeout defines for how long the BLE connection is maintained despite the peers being unable to communicate at the currently configured connection interval.

register.title: Notifications Registration Timeout
register.description: The client must register to notifications/indication before this timeout occurs. If not the client will be disconnected. Defaults to 30s.

register.title: Extra options
register.description: Extra BLE options

register.title: Channel map for Sets 0 (application) and 1 (beacon)
register.description: Channels used while advertising.

register.title: iBeacon ID
register.description: Major ID and Minor ID used for iBeacon broadcasting

register.title: Configuration of the main smartcard slot (ID-1)

option.title: Class A or Class B (5V or 3.3V)
Class B or Class C (3.3V or 1.8V)
Class A or Class B or Class C (5V, 3.3V or 1.8V)

register.title: Configuration of the first ID-000 slot ("SAM A")

option.title: Class A or Class B (5V or 3.3V)
Class B or Class C (3.3V or 1.8V)
Class A or Class B or Class C (5V, 3.3V or 1.8V)

register.title: Configuration of the other ID-000 slots ("SAM B", "SAM C" and "SAM D")

option.title: Class A or Class B (5V or 3.3V)
Class B or Class C (3.3V or 1.8V)
Class A or Class B or Class C (5V, 3.3V or 1.8V)

register.title: Default value for some ATR bytes
Fine tuning of the T=0 timings

field.title: Total timeout for T=0 APDUs (in seconds)
field.name: Timeout
field.remark: Set to 00 to disable this timeout

register.title: Fine tuning of the T=1 timings

field.title: Total timeout for T=1 APDUs (in seconds)
field.name: Timeout
field.remark: Set to 00 to disable this timeout

option.title: Perform GET RESPONSE automatically after SW=61XX

field.title: CLA of the GET RESPONSE command
field.name: GET RESPONSE CLA
field.remark: Set to FF to use the same as the current APDU's. Default 00 is mandatory for EMV compliance.

register.title: Misc. options for the smartcard slots

field.title: Correct wrong length or LRC in ATR
field.name: atr_correct_len_lrc

option.title: Correct invalid ATRs (ensure compliance with PC/SC driver prior 20.10)

field.title: Mask RFU TA1 values in ATR
field.name: atr_mask_rfu_ta1

option.title: Replace RFU TA1 values in ATR (ensure compliance with PC/SC driver prior 20.10)

register.title: Which PC/SC slots are announced to the computer

field.title: Expose the SAM AV through PC/SC
field.name: SAM AV

option.title: The SAM AV is used only internally
The SAM AV has its own PC/SC slot (USE WITH CARE)

field.title: Disable the other SAM slots ("SAM B", "SAM C" and "SAM D")
field.name: No SAM B-C-D

option.title: The other SAM slots are enabled
The other SAM slots are disabled

field.title: Disable the first SAM slot ("SAM" or "SAM A")
field.name: No SAM A

field.title: Disable the second Contact slot ("Contact B")
field.name: No Contact B

field.title: Disable the first Contact slot ("Contact" or "Contact A")
field.name: No Contact A

register.title: Options to control how the slots are named, and their order of enumeration

field.title: How are the slot numbers created
field.name: Order

field.title: Add a part of the device identification data into the names of the slots
field.name: Add device id

option.title: Do not add a device id
Add the complete serial number (in hex)
Add the last 2 bytes of the serial number (in hex)
Add the IPv4 address (if the device as a network interface)

field.title: Force a letter in the name of the SAM slots (eg "SAM A", "SAM B" etc)
field.name: Force SAM index

option.title: No letter for a single SAM ("SAM" only)
Even a single SAM is named "SAM A"

field.title: Force a letter in the name of the ID-1 slots (eg "Contact A", "Contact B" etc)
field.name: Force ID-1 index

option.title: No letter for a single Contact slot ("Contact" only)
Even a single Contact slot is named "Contact A"

field.title: Method for CCID Time Extension (empty) data-blocks
field.name: Time Extension mode
field.remark: The Time Extension frames are mandatory with the CCID driver from the PC/SC-Lite project.

option.title: Send a Time Extension frame when the card has sent a WTX or a 60 procedure byte
Send a Time Extension frame every 1s
Send a Time Extension frame every 2s
Disable sending the Time Extension frame

field.title: Implement CCID without the Interrupt endpoint
field.name: Disable Interrupt EP
field.remark: The Interrupt EP is mandatory with Windows PC/SC driver and most SpringCard-supplied CCID implementations. It shall be disabled only when the product is used with a legacy CCID driver that has a bogus Interrupt implementation.

field.title: Hide CCID class in the USB descriptor
field.name: Hide CCID on USB

option.title: The USB class of the CCID interface is 0B (SmartCard)
The USB class of the CCID interface is FF (vendor specific)

field.title: Time to wait before CCID operation after the SET_CONFIGURATION control (10th of second)
field.name: Wait after start

field.title: Time to wait before CCID operation after the first GET_STATUS request (10th of second)
field.name: Wait after probe

register.title: Class of the embedded APDU interpreter
register.description: A PC/SC reader features an APDU interpreter to expose wired-logic, memory-only cards as if they were compliant with ISO/IEC 7816-4. The PC/SC specification mandates that the interpreter handles C-APDU coming with CLA=`FF`. This register allows to change this value. Setting it to `00` totally disables the product's embedded APDU interpreter.

field.title: Class of the embedded APDU interpreter
